title: The Dollar Has Its Worst Start to a Year Since 1973
summary: It has continued to slide even as President Trump has backed down from his tariff threats and the U.S. stock market has recovered from its losses.

title: Canada’s Digital Tax U-turn Highlights Trump and Carney’s Tariff Negotiation Tactics
summary: After President Trump suspended trade talks with Canada over its controversial digital services tax, Ottawa scrapped it to get back to the negotiating table.

title: Trump’s Threat of More Tariffs Slows Trade Deals
summary: As America’s largest trading partners race toward deals, they are increasingly worried about being hit with future tariffs on their critical industries.

title: Trump Steps Up Pressure Campaign on Powell With Handwritten Note
summary: President Trump has repeatedly attacked Jerome H. Powell, chair of the Federal Reserve, for resisting his demands for lower interest rates.

title: Here Are the Republican Senators Who May Revolt on Trump’s Bill
summary: Senate Republicans can afford to lose no more than three of their own votes on the bill, but two already are opposed and others remained undecided.

title: The Republicans in Congress Who Are Opting to Self-Deport From Washington
summary: Feeling out of step with President Trump’s G.O.P., Senator Thom Tillis and Representative Don Bacon are deciding to retire.

title: Senate’s New A.I. Moratorium Proposal Draws Fresh Criticism
summary: Language in the chamber’s spending bill says that state laws related to A.I. cannot pose an “undue or disproportionate burden” to tech companies.

title: Bryan Kohberger, Suspect in Idaho Student Murders, Accepts Plea Deal
summary: Bryan Kohberger, a former criminology student, was set to go on trial this summer in the stabbing deaths of four University of Idaho students.

title: Idaho Murders Suspect Felt ‘No Emotion’ and ‘Little Remorse’ as a Teen
summary: Messages and online posts from the Ph.D. student now charged with four murders show that he was once detached and suicidal before he became fascinated with criminals’ minds.

title: ‘The Bear’ Is Back, but Where’s the Beef?
summary: The restaurant’s business challenge in Season 4 — balancing comfort food and haute cuisine — is also a metaphor for the show’s creative issues.

title: Could a Michelin Star Actually Save the Restaurant in ‘The Bear?’
summary: In Season 4 of the hit FX show, accolades are on the mind of Carmy Berzatto and his staff. But how much do they help real businesses?

title: ‘The Bear’ Season 4: Here Are the Cameos
summary: “The Bear” returned for its fourth season this week with high-stakes restaurant drama and high-wattage cameos.

title: Appeals Court Weighs Trump’s Use of Alien Enemies Act for Deportations
summary: The case is likely to be the first to reach the Supreme Court on the substantive issue of the president’s invocation of a rarely used wartime law.

title: Why Trump Had So Many Supreme Court Wins
summary: The New York Times Supreme Court reporter Adam Liptak recaps this Supreme Court term, which was defined by a disproportionate amount of emergency docket cases. Liptak explains why these cases tended to go in the Trump administration’s favor.

title: NYC Panel Approves Rent Increases, a Key Issue for Mamdani and Adams
summary: Mayor Eric Adams, who appointed the Rent Guidelines Board, has attacked Zohran Mamdani’s pledge to freeze the rent if he becomes mayor.

title: Landlords Say They’re Struggling. Rents Keep Going Up. What Gives?
summary: New York City could soon raise rents on some of its most affordable apartments to help landlords who say they aren’t earning enough. But renters say they’re hurting, too.

title: Gulf States Lead Push to Invest in New Syria
summary: The fall of the Syrian dictator Bashar al-Assad has opened a window for wealthy Gulf countries to expand their influence as the sway of Iran diminishes.

title: Trump Lifts Sanctions on Syria, Tightening His Embrace of Its New Leader
summary: U.S. officials said sanctions against targets such as its central bank would end, but they would remain on Syria’s former dictator, Bashar al-Assad.

title: Cartel Fighters Make a Desperate Alliance That Could Transform Underworld
summary: The Sinaloa Cartel, the world’s most-feared fentanyl trafficker, is reeling from an internal war and a U.S.-Mexican crackdown. Its fate could upend global criminal networks.

title: The War Within the Sinaloa Cartel Explained
summary: One of the world’s most powerful criminal syndicates is facing a government crackdown and internal war after the son of a drug lord betrayed his partner.

title: Judge Amir Ali Has One of the Hardest Jobs In Washington
summary: Amir Ali joined the D.C. Federal District Court just weeks before Trump took office. It’s been tumultuous ever since.

title: ‘The Bomb Lady’ and the Forerunner of the ‘Bunker Buster’ Used in Iran
summary: While a child in wartime Vietnam, Anh Duong vowed to one day help the soldiers who saved her. She and her Navy team helped revolutionize American munitions.

title: Fordo Nuclear Site Work Taking Place in Iran, Satellate Images Show
summary: Amid competing assessments of how badly the enrichment facility was damaged in U.S. strikes, Iran appears to be making its own inspection.

title: Gaza City Cafe Hit by Deadly Strike
summary: The restaurant, a destination for Palestinians seeking a respite or internet access, was reduced to a mere shell by the blast.

title: A Common Assumption About Aging May Be Wrong, Study Suggests
summary: Experts have long pointed to inflammation as a natural part of getting older. But a new paper suggests it might be more a product of our environment.

title: At Glastonbury, Left-Wing Politics Are Shocking Again
summary: Trying to stamp out anti-Israel rhetoric only lends it the frisson of forbidden truth.

title: Trump’s Big Policy Bill Still Faces Hurdles
summary: Also, the Supreme Court agreed to hear a major campaign finance case. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Jury Ends First Day of Deliberations Without a Verdict
summary: The jury deciding the sex-trafficking case was interrupted for an hour when the foreperson told the court that a juror was having trouble following the judge’s instructions.

title: Juniper Fire in California Prompts Evacuation Order
summary: The wildfire, in Riverside County, east of Los Angeles, burned more than 600 acres in just a few hours on Monday. About 5,000 people were ordered to leave their homes.

title: How the Brooklyn Bridge Ship Disaster Unfolded
summary: An initial report from the National Transportation Safety Board described the moments before a Mexican Navy ship crashed into the Brooklyn Bridge.

title: Idaho Shooting Suspect Identified in Deadly Ambush of Firefighters
summary: The authorities believe that the suspect, who was found dead on Canfield Mountain, set a brush fire and shot at the firefighters who responded, killing two.
